title: Stocks Are Set to Extend Sharp Fall
abstract: Futures on the S&P 500, which allow investors to trade the index before the official start of trading on Monday, added to last week’s sell-off.

title: Marcia Marcus, Painter Rediscovered in Her Last Decade, Dies at 97
abstract: A popular downtown artist in the 1960s, she worked in obscurity after art world trends left her behind. Now her startlingly fresh work is on view again.

multimedia.caption: Marcia Marcus’s 1973 painting “Self-Portrait as Athena.” She painted herself over and over again, in a variety of costumes and settings.

title: Jay North, Child Star From ‘Dennis the Menace,’ Dies at 73
abstract: Mr. North was best known for playing the towheaded Dennis Mitchell on the television series, which ran on CBS from 1959 to 1963.
byline: By Alexandra E. Petri and Daniel E. Slotnik

title: Bitcoin Is Down 10% Since Trump’s Global Tariff Announcement

title: Trump’s Tariffs Imperil the Fortunes of a Nissan Factory Town
abstract: Kanda, on Japan’s southern coast, grew in tandem with an auto plant that sends half of the cars it makes to the United States.
byline: By River Akira Davis and Hisako Ueno

title: In a Strongman State, a Trump Order Extinguishes Flickers of Freedom
abstract: Cambodia’s authoritarian dynasty had silenced almost all of the country’s independent media. The remaining few are facing extinction because of an executive directive from President Trump.
byline: By Hannah Beech and Sun Narin
org_facet: United States Agency for International Development

multimedia.caption: Uon Chhin, left, and Yeang Sothearin, former journalists with Radio Free Asia, arriving at a court in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in 2019.

title: China Tries to Downplay the Trade War’s Effects on Its Economy
abstract: Faced with economic disruption, Beijing is presenting itself as too powerful to succumb to U.S. pressure. It is also censoring criticism at home.
byline: By David Pierson, Claire Fu and Vivian Wang
